intro: Vernonia nepetifolia, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces clusters of small, blue to violet flowers, which bloom in late summer and early fall. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically hairy and arranged oppositely along the stems. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Vernonia nepetifolia is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
